body.para: If I send out a letter lets say a resume on Writer (same as Word) will other companies be able to open and read as Word? Right now I have Microsoft Works Processor and it is unacceptable and does not work. Other places cannot open. Thanks.

quote.quotepara: ----- Original Message ----- From: "Dave Barton" <db@tasit.net> To: <users@openoffice.org> Cc: "Vinny LoGuidice" <vinny32@comcast.net> Sent: Tuesday, March 06, 2007 11:41 PM Subject: Re: [users] [moderated] I downloaded!!!
-------- Original Message -------- From: Vinny LoGuidice <vinny32@comcast.net> Date: Wed 07 Mar 2007 03:16:53 EST

I just downloaded as I am looking to add Word to my computer. Now I have a lot of different icons and info on my desktop. Do I need all this info? Most importantly how do I find Word here? Thanks a bunch. Please advise.

Firstly OOo (OpenOffice.org) is not Microsoft Office, so it does not have Word. OOo is an office suite and contains similar programs. The OOo equivalents are: Writer = Word Calc = Excel Impress = Powerpoint Base = Access

From your description, it is not clear if you have run the installation program, but the fact that you have a lot of icons on the desktop suggests that you may have already done this. Go to your "Start -> All Programs" menu and see if you have the new programs listed there. If so, then you can delete all of those new icons from your desktop. If you haven't installed the program, read the instructions here:http://download.openoffice.org/2.1.0/instructions.html There is also a link to an "Extensive setup guide" on that page.
quote.quotefooter: -- This is a mailing list which exists to support users of OpenOffice.org All answers are given by other users who volunteer their time. If you are not subscribed to this mailing list you may not see all the replies to your query. Please reply to users@openoffice.org only and include some indication that you are not subscribed to this list. (eg. "I am not subscribed to this list, please CC: me.")
quote.quotepara: For on-line support see: http://support.openoffice.org/index.html For a knowledge base see: http://mindmeld.cybersite.com.au/
